title: 105_s2319
content: The Act titled "Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamp Promotion Act of 1998" promotes the sales of stamps. The Act of March 16, 1934 is amended to allow the Secretary of the Interior to use up to $1,000,000 annually from stamp sales for promoting additional sales, subject to approval by the Migratory Bird Conservation Commission. The Secretary of the Interior is required to include all expenditures in the annual report under the Migratory Bird Conservation Act and provide a copy to specific committees. Additionally, technical amendments are made to the Act of March 16, 1934. The Secretary of the Interior is required to include all expenditures in the annual report under the Migratory Bird Conservation Act and provide a copy to specific committees. Additionally, technical amendments are made to the Act of March 16, 1934. The short title of the section is SEC. 11. The Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamp Act is amended in various sections to update references and titles. The Migratory Bird Hunting Stamp Act of 1934 is amended to the Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamp Act in various sections. The Migratory Bird Hunting Stamp Act of 1934 is amended to the Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamp Act in several sections of different laws. Section 28(f) of the Act of August 13, 1954 is amended to replace references to the Migratory Bird Hunting Stamp Act of 1934 with the Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamp Act. The Act of March 16, 1934 is amended to update references to the migratory bird hunting and conservation stamp. This includes changes to various sections of the Act to reflect the new terminology. The Act of March 16, 1934 is amended to update references to migratory bird hunting stamps, replacing them with migratory bird hunting and conservation stamps in various sections of the Act. The Act of March 16, 1934 is amended to update references to migratory bird hunting stamps by replacing them with "migratory bird hunting and conservation stamps" in Section 3(a) of the Act of July 30, 1956.
